biog.entry.name: ELLIS, the Hon. Katherine (Kate) Margaret
biog.entry.description: Biography for ELLIS, the Hon. Katherine (Kate) Margaret
biog.entry.electorate.name: Member for Adelaide (SA)
biog.entry.title: Biography for ELLIS, the Hon. Katherine (Kate) Margaret
biog.entry.electorate.state.name: Member for Adelaide (SA)
biog.entry.party.name: Australian Labor Party

parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the House of Representatives for Adelaide, South Australia, 2004, 2007, 2010 and 2013.

ministerial.appointments.title: Ministerial Appointments
ministerial.appointments.para: Minister for Early Childhood Education, Childcare and Youth from 9.6.09 to 14.9.10.
Minister for the Status of Women from 14.9.10 to 14.12.11.
Minister for Employment Participation and Childcare from 14.9.10 to 14.12.11.
Minister for Employment Participation from 14.12.11 to 18.9.13.
Minister for Early Childhood and Childcare from 14.12.11 to 1.7.13.
Minister for Early Childhood, Childcare and Youth from 1.7.13 to 18.9.13.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: House of Representatives Standing: Family and Human Services from 2.12.04 to 17.10.07; Education and Employment from 4.12.13 to 27.2.14.

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Member, Opposition Shadow Ministry from 14.10.13. Shadow Minister for Education and Shadow Minister for Early Childhood from 18.10.13.

party.positions.title: Party Positions
party.positions.para: Secretary, ALP Caucus Committee on Economics from 2004.
Member, ALP National Policy Committee from 2005.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: Ministerial Adviser to the Hon. R McEwen, MHA (SA) 2003-04.
Ministerial Adviser to the Deputy Premier (SA), the Hon. K Foley, MHA 2004.

electorate.title: Electorate
electorate.para: Location: central Adelaide; it includes the city of Adelaide and the suburbs of Ashford, Clarence Park, Enfield, Goodwood, Kent Town, Keswick, Kilburn, Maylands, North Adelaide, Northgate, Norwood, Parkside, Prospect, Rose Park, St Peters, Toorak Gardens, Unley and Walkerville.
Industries: markets, newspapers, military barracks, universities, brewery, bottlers, rail and bus terminals and Adelaide central business district.
State electorates: Adelaide includes the South Australian House of Assembly electorate of Adelaide, and parts of Ashford, Bragg, Croydon, Dunstan, Enfield, Torrens, Unley and West Torrens.
